name: Rock Paper Scissors
info: Most Recent project that I worked on. This mobile based app lets the user interact with a javascript AI choice randomizer, and plays a round of rock paper scissors. Created the UI/UX styles and app functionality.

name: GigIt
info: Project I had the pleasure of working on with my team from my cohort. I worked primarily on UX/UI design of the app, as well as custom styling with CSS. I also helped with backend database logic and bringing the data back to the user. This project used React.js, custom CSS3, Auth0, Google Authentication, Mongo DB, react-bootstrap, Node.js, and Express for local development

name: Dad-Life
info: This was a project I worked on with a group, I primarily worked on the UI/UX design, and created the logo and icons. Also dove deeply into the backend logic for user authentication with passport.js. This project used HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, Node.js, passport, handlebars, MySQL database, and heroku

name: Code Quiz
info: In this project Javascript was used to manipulate the DOM and create the quiz logic.  Local Storage was used to save the user’s name and display it at the end of the quiz.

name: Weather App
info: Created using Javascript, Jquery and Ajax.  API calls were used and rendered to the DOM.

name: Dream Destination
info: This group project used API calls to obtain information and weather about the user’s travel destination.

name: Eat-The-Burger
info: This app uses Node Express server and Handle Bars to display information from a MySQL database. It is also able to manipulate the database with an input and click event.
